image.altText: A design of the new civic centre building.

props.synopsis: The Darwin city council will soon begin building a $150 million CBD high-rise to replace its aging civic centre, in partnership with property developer DCOH.

title.children: $150m high-rise to replace Darwin city council headquarters

image.altText: A woman looks into the distance

props.synopsis: NT Police say there's been a significant drop in the rates of illegal alcohol supply in Gove, as authorities move to keep liquor restrictions going into the future.

title.children: Black market alcohol drops, DV rates steady after remote liquor trial

image.altText: Looking down from the top of Gunlom Falls in the Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth and Kakadu traditional owners are set to sign a new agreement over the jointly-managed national park ahead of Gunlom Falls' long-anticipated reopening this dry season.

title.children: Kakadu National Park lease to be renewed ahead of Gunlom Falls reopening

image.altText: A man looks into a burnt out room.

props.synopsis: A family-owned Alice Springs business is determined to stay open after a devastating fire causes millions of dollars in damage.

title.children: Outback business vows to rebuild after blaze 'like a nuclear bomb'

image.altText: A still from CCTV footage shows three security guards (faces blurred) surrounding a man on the ground

props.synopsis: Footage emerges of three government-funded security guards kicking and stomping on a man on a Darwin street.

title.children: NT pseudo-cops filmed kicking a man's head like a soccer ball

image.altText: A long neon lit hallway with doors to cells.

props.synopsis: Human rights lawyers and Aboriginal leaders lodge a complaint urging the United Nations to address Australia's "discriminatory" and "punitive" youth justice policies.

title.children: NT singled out in UN action on Australia's 'racist' youth crime laws

image.altText: The blue-and-white Vote compass logo: The words, with a tick through the "o" of "Vote".

props.synopsis: You can cut through some of the election noise with Vote Compass.

title.children: See how your views align with the major parties through Vote Compass

image.altText: Donald Trump stands and speaks at a podium in front of a portrait of Ronald Reagan

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's preoccupation with tariffs isn't new. But economists say US history shows trade barriers end up costing consumers and businesses more.

title.children: History of American tariffs offers stark insights into Trump's plans

image.altText: A graphic image shows Khawaja Moeen Haroon, dressed in a dark suit and tie.

props.synopsis: On the western outskirts of Melbourne, where the paddocks meet new homes, lies the centre of an alleged NDIS fraudster's network.

title.children: How a man under investigation for fraud built an NDIS empire

image.altText: woman with white blonde hair and wearing a navy suit looks down the camera

props.synopsis: In a statement, her family says Ms Giuffre's vehicle was hit by a school bus in rural Western Australia, but she returned home before going to hospital.

title.children: Virginia Giuffre remains in 'serious condition' after bus crash, family says

image.altText: An older woman with grey hair and a pink shirt stares into the camera, while sitting on an outdoor lounge.

props.synopsis: Western Sydney, which is a region made up of 14 seats, is considered as integral to the major parties for the upcoming federal election.

title.children: Helen has voted Labor for 40 years. There are a few reasons she won't this time

image.altText: Steph Hodgins-May speaks in the senate

props.synopsis: At some point, the major political parties will have to confront the failures in Australia’s early childhood education and care system head on.

title.children: The perfect election issue is being overlooked by most politicians

image.altText: Five gas cylinders next to each other with multiple pipes connected together.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton is under pressure to publish modelling and details of his gas plan, which has faced a barrage of industry condemnation.

title.children: Taxpayers could be on hook if foreign companies sue over Dutton gas plan

image.altText: A ute and two people walking in street filled with floodwater.

props.synopsis: Queenslanders displaced by catastrophic flooding are sitting tight as they wait to return to their homes, but it is already clear that the road to recovery will be long and difficult.

title.children: Outback 'boneyards' emerging, more rain to come for flooded Queenslanders

image.altText: A close-up of Luigi Mangione.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's attorney-general orders prosecutors to seek the death penalty for Luigi Mangione, the man accused of murdering a health insurance boss on a New York street last year.

title.children: Luigi Mangione an early target of Trump orders on death penalty

props.synopsis: A project in regional NSW has shown the number of students at risk of homelessness can be halved with a "deceptively simple" intervention.

title.children: Can we end youth homelessness before it begins? One city shows it can be done

image.altText: Min Aung Hlaing wears a military dress uniform with medals on his chest and around his neck.

props.synopsis: Multiple Western aid agencies said they have struggled to get personnel into Myanmar as the ruling junta leads the response to the country's largest natural disaster in years.

title.children: In Myanmar's darkest hour, this dictator cloaks the country in secrecy

image.altText: Packages of Coles leafy salad products, containing potentially contaminated spinach

props.synopsis: Nearly 50 pre-packaged salad products are being recalled by major supermarkets after E. coli was found during routine testing.

title.children: Source of salad contamination sought after major supermarket recall

image.altText: Rick Nugent, dressed in a police uniform, stands a lectern indoors.

props.synopsis: Rick Nugent confirms he will not apply for the ongoing position but says he is still Victoria's acting chief commissioner amid media reports.

title.children: Breaking: Victoria's top cop Rick Nugent confirms he won't apply for ongoing job

image.altText: A young woman with a tattooed arm and a full-face helmet flashes a "V" sign in a car with a rollcage.

props.synopsis: A horror motorcycle accident left Christina Vithoulkas with complete loss of feeling and movement below her T5 vertebrae. She is now the world's first female para drifter.

title.children: How Christina went from a horror accident to the becoming the first female para drifter

image.altText: A man in a black suit looks off to the left side.

props.synopsis: With the row over whether Tasmania can afford a new stadium a long way from ending, Labor may think it can be a spectator to the melee. But, if Labor votes for the project and it goes badly, it'll be tied to the failure as well.

title.children: If Labor hitches its wagon to a stadium project flop, it'll be tied to the failure as well

image.altText: Bottles of Pepsi are pictured at a grocery store in California.

props.synopsis: A High Court hearing for a challenge between PepsiCo and the Australian Tax Office today will be an important test of Australia's laws set up to tax overseas companies appearing to derive profits here.

title.children: PepsiCo faces Australian Tax Office in High Court

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin sitting at a desk with a Russian flag behind him.

props.synopsis: The Russian military has been seeking to boost its military to some 1.5 million active soldiers, as the country continues its conflict in Ukraine.

title.children: Putin launches fresh conscription drive to find 160,000 more troops

image.altText: Australian cricket great Ricky Ponting smiles as he stands wearing a suit at jacket on the ground at Lord's.

props.synopsis: Ricky Ponting's Punjab Kings make light work of Justin Langer's Lucknow Super Giants in the IPL as players leave rave reviews for Ponting in the aftermath of the result.

title.children: Ponting lauded as 'one of the best coaches' after ousting Langer's IPL side

image.altText: An illustration of a husband and wife pulling apart their own half of the family home

props.synopsis: A new report has revealed that Australia's divorce rates have fallen to their lowest levels in almost 50 years. But the reason why is not as simple as it seems.

title.children: 'Women who aren't able to leave': Understanding Australia's low divorce rate

image.altText: Panoramic view of lava

props.synopsis: A volcanic eruption in Iceland has triggered an evacuation near the nation's capital.

title.children: Iceland town and Blue Lagoon spa evacuated after volcano erupts

image.altText: Yuki Tsunoda taking part in a promotional shoot, hands on his knees, bending forward

props.synopsis: The saga surrounding Red Bull Racing and its drivers has dominated the Formula 1 news cycle, as the next chapter begins at this weekend's Japanese Grand Prix.

title.children: 'Feels like fate': Red Bull driver saga gears up for next chapter

image.altText: an obviously fake prosthetic eye

props.synopsis: Losing an eye is a traumatic experience, having an artificial eye made should help with the healing process. For these people, who were clients of Jack McDonald, it wasn't.

title.children: Complaints about 'unacceptable' eye maker in unregulated industry

image.altText: A group of people outside a church

props.synopsis: A bid to build affordable units on church land in Brisbane's east has been approved despite protests from home owners who claim it's "inappropriate".

title.children: Brisbane home owners fail to stop church building affordable houses

image.altText: Rachel Zegler as Snow White in a forest holding her hand out for a firefly to land on.

props.synopsis: Almost 90 years after their first imagining of Snow White, Disney decided to take another bite of the apple. But what does each era's "fairest of them all" reflect about attitudes towards women?

title.children: How Snow White holds a (magic) mirror up to society

image.altText: A shimmering flood plain with a mountain in the background.

props.synopsis: There are calls for the state government to set a concrete timeline for its target of preserving 17 per cent of its landmass, with just 595,000 hectares protected since 2022.

title.children: 'Obligation to the world': Queensland has no timeline for key environmental goal

image.altText: NSW Police tape

props.synopsis: The young child remains in hospital in a serious condition, and the driver is assisting police.

title.children: Child suffers life-threatening injuries after being hit by teenage driver

image.altText: People crossing a city road as rain falls, one is holding an umbrella.

props.synopsis: Parts of south-east Queensland could get up to 100 millimetres of rain on Wednesday as the remnants of ex-Tropical Cyclone Dianne sweep the state.

title.children: More rain for south-east Queensland as last of ex-cyclone Dianne sweeps state

image.altText: A worried-looking woman and man standing in a park.

props.synopsis: As NSW prepares to ban no-grounds evictions, some renters believe they're being forced out as landlords try to get ahead of the change.

title.children: Tenants fear surge of evictions ahead of major rental law reforms

props.synopsis: We won’t know until after this election who has donated to the political parties for this campaign. But voters are sceptical, with some of our listeners questioning the role of billionaires in our politics.

title.children: Your questions: Is Gina Rinehart an oligarch?
